snippet: William Klinger traveled to the United States last month, lured by a dream of a better life than the one he had in Italy. Instead, he wound up dead in a New York park.
abstract: Sequence of events that investigators have cobbled together that led to shooting death of William Klinger in Astoria Park is disputed by Alexander Bonich, man who has been charged with Klinger's murder; Bonich claims that Klinger was having midlife crisis and had become erratic, whereas all other indications suggest that Klinger believed that Bonich had created fraudulent fantasy that convinced Klinger to immigrate to America.

byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and ELISABETTA POVOLEDO
byline.contributor: J. David Goodman reported from New York, and Elisabetta Povoledo from Rome.J. David Goodman reported from New York, and Elisabetta Povoledo from Rome.

lead_paragraph: William Klinger traveled to the United States last month, lured by a dream of a better life than the one he had in Italy. Instead, he wound up dead in a New York park.

headline.main: How a Friendship Built in Europe Turned Fatal in Queens
headline.print_headline: Friendship Built in Europe Turns Fatal in Queens
